channel.title: Deleting an .exe file
channel.description:
Recently I downloaded a client to give proof that it was a virus so that no one else would download it and be infected. Now when it comes time to deleting it it tells me I need permission to delete it. I give it permission to be removed and it says the action has been denied. Any ideas?
[IMG]http://i28.tinypic.com/210x6vc.png[/img]

item.title: Deleting an .exe file
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You could have also booted into safe mode and deleted it. And finally what will work all the time every time is boot into your linux partition or a linux live cd and delete your file from there.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting an .exe file
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Did as you said and it was removed. Thankyou Kihomura.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting an .exe file
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

When it says no locking handle was found, choose the “Delete” option and click OK. Then restart your computer and the file should be gone.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting an .exe file
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

The unlocker was not able to remove it. It says no locking handle was found. Any other ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting an .exe file
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Download this program called Unlocker.
http://ccollomb.free.fr/unlocker/

It should allow you to delete files hassle free. Especially that error “This file is in use by another application”

Read full topic
